meanings.definition: The arrangement or coordination of a musical composition for performance by an orchestra.
meanings.sent1: The orchestrations of the symphony were beautifully done.
meanings.sent2: She studied orchestrations to understand how to compose for an orchestra.
meanings.sent3: The orchestrations of the concert were so precise that even the birds stopped to listen.
meanings.sent4: His orchestrations of the instruments created a harmonious blend of sounds.
meanings.sent5: The orchestrations of the music transported the audience to another world.

meanings.definition: The act of organizing or coordinating various elements to achieve a desired outcome.
meanings.sent1: The orchestrations of the event made everything run smoothly.
meanings.sent2: Effective orchestrations of resources led to the project's success.
meanings.sent3: The orchestrations of the party decorations were so creative that everyone was amazed.
meanings.sent4: Her orchestrations of the team members' tasks were like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The orchestrations of the plan ensured that everything fell into place perfectly.
